## Summary
- Rule available since: `v1.0.0`
- Diagnostic Category: [`lint/style/useSingleVarDeclarator`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- This rule has an [**unsafe**](/linter/#unsafe-fixes) fix.
- The default severity of this rule is [**warning**](/reference/diagnostics#warning).
- Sources: 
  - Same as [`one-var`](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/one-var)

## Description
Disallow multiple variable declarations in the same variable statement

In JavaScript, multiple variables can be declared within a single `var`, `const` or `let` declaration.
It is often considered a best practice to declare every variable separately.
That is what this rule enforces.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
let foo = 0, bar, baz;
```

### Valid

```js
const foo = 0;
let bar;
let baz;
```

```js
for (let i = 0, x = 1; i < arr.length; i++) {}
```

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"style": {
				"useSingleVarDeclarator": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
